PowerPointFilePath: Buffalo Rock Cooler Product Placement Loading_v1.29.24.pptx
Title: Objective: In this lesson the student will learn how to stock coolers with 20 oz Buffalo Rock products.

Pages.Title: Open Cooler
Pages.Subtitle: Open the right-side cooler door

Contents.Text: Open the door wide to maximize the working area.

Pages.Title: Remove Product
Pages.Subtitle: Click the highlighted Pepsi inside the cooler.

Contents.Text: Products that are soon to expire are considered “cold”. Remove any cold products from the cooler and set them aside, outside of the cooler.

Pages.Title: Pick Up Crate
Pages.Subtitle: Click on the highlighted Pepsi drink crate.

Contents.Text: Select the top crate full of new products.

Pages.Title: Shelve Product
Pages.Subtitle: Place the newly received Pepsi product into the cooler.

Contents.Text: Each Pepsi in the crate should have the same expiration date. Newer products should always be placed in the back of the cooler, with the label facing forward.

Pages.Title: Product Placement
Pages.Subtitle: Ensure proper product placement.

Contents.Text: Ensure that the label on each bottle is facing forward, so that the product is clearly visible to the customer.

Pages.Title: Pick Up Pepsi
Pages.Subtitle: Something something

Contents.Text:
Click on the highlighted Pepsi.
Select “Pick Up Pepsi.”

Pages.Title: Re-shelve Pepsi
Pages.Subtitle: Load Pepsi into the cooler prioritizing expiration dates across the row.

Contents.Text:
Read each expiration date located on the bottle and cap.
The drink furthest from expiring should go into the “Dead Zone” while the drink closest to the expiration date should go in the “Hot Zone”.

Pages.Title: Product Placement
Pages.Subtitle: Ensure proper product placement.

Contents.Text: Ensure that the label on each bottle is facing forward, so that the product is clearly visible to the customer.
